text:
Big cut of chicken chop that was nicely seasoned. Meat is juicy and flavourful with nicely charred skin.

Mash was flavourful as well. Fries were a tad stale as food had been tabao-ed, but was nicely salted taste-wise.

Also came with corn/ lettuce + sauces that were separately packed.

$6.80 for dine-in, $7.10 for take-away
Waiting time was around 5-10mins üëçüèª

Standard foodcourt setting.  I was just craving for some western food and came across this stall.
Ordered chicken chop @$6.80.
While waiting for my food, saw the review that was so bad and started to worry.
Honestly, I only waited within 5 mins.
The chicken is tender and the fries is just freshly fried.
A thumbs up for you‚ù§Ô∏èüí™üèº
The chicken chop is very dry and stiff, the food served was also very slow even when there is not much people. Not worth for the price.
Food is slightly below average. Staff was not good with Mandarin

Need to avoid if you‚Äôre in hunger.
Not much people but easily takes above 20 minutes to serve the food.
